alert.note: Alert for West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 4:12PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Polk and southeastern Grand Forks Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 411 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thompson, or 9 miles southwest of Grand Forks, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Merrifield around 420 PM CDT. Grand Forks and Bygland around 425 PM CDT. Mallory around 430 PM CDT. East Grand Forks and Davidson around 435 PM CDT. Tabor and Sherack around 455 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Grand Forks Airport. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 130 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Minnesota...and northeastern North Dakota.
